Reviews.Title: “great youth hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, rich breakfast, very cheap , just little noisy

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: SebiAdventure
Reviews.Content: The Aletto youth Hotel in Berlin Kreuzberg is between Ubh Möckernbrücke U7 and Ubh Hallesches Tor U1. Its very central and you get everywhere with the bus or the underground really quick. Straight next to it is a great dance school called Flying Steps Dance Academy one of the best Urban schools in Germany. Its worth do go there. And don't miss the Döner Kebab around the corner at Mehringdamm called Mustafa, its one of the best in Berlin. The Hotel itself is not really good, but you have Wifi and the rooms are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for student groups”
Reviews.Author: Johnathan B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aletto with a group of 30 students from Prague. I found the staff to be kind and accomodating. The price was right and the breakfast good. I was amazed that these people bent over backwartds to accomadate the various allergies and difficulties that 30 teens bring with them. We appreciated the location, where our bus could easily pick us up in the mornings or we could walk to some of the best curry sausage joints or to Checkpoint Charlie. If I were a single traveler or older than say 30, I would avoid this pllace if zou have a low tolerance for noise and squealing girls, especially at half term. Other than that it was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but with noisy teens and a strange attitude sound policy”
Reviews.Author: Gbrm2011
Reviews.Content: positive points: Relatively good location, around 20 min by foot to the central atractions, good breakfast, around 4 min by foot from metro, confortable room, reasonable price negative points: very noisy with lots of teens, don’t have free internet computer(that is 50 cents for each 15 min), don’t have a safe, thin walls(you can hear almost everything of the next room) I was disturbed on the first night around 11 pm by strong knocks on my rooms door and shouts in german of someone, that I couldn’t understand, this situation scared me, and I didn’t answered or opened the door; later I discovered that the hotel has a kind of a “curfew of noise” of 10 pm to 06am (I only was with the TV turned on), that would be a good thing if that guy could be much more polite, besides of speak in English. On the room next to me there was very noisy teens, they was frequentely approached by “the guy that knock the doors”, but continued no act noisy late at night, including slaping doors. It was a very disturbing situation, the “noisy curfew” dont work at all.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bargain at Euro 36 a night”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAsbestos
Reviews.Content: You will always get what you pay for. This hostel cost me 36 Euro a night. The room was small had 6 beds in it, but was clean and tidy. It was secure. Even though 6 beds 36 euro offered the whole room. Ideal for a family, or students or even a business traveller coming to the end of the financial year. Car parking is difficult, but I've stayed there three timers and always manged to park on tempelhofer ufer, right outside! Ideally placed for technischer museum, potsdammer platz and 200 yards from Markischer Halles / GleisDriecke. Breakfast is a bit of a free for all is school parties are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Says "hotel", but you get there and the sign says "HOSTEL".”
Reviews.Author: seputus
Reviews.Content: Well, this is what I get for even trying a hotel(hostel) that was ranked so poorly in Tripadvisor... This place was a dump, with horrible service. It's simply a way to con people out of as much money as possible while maintaining an air of actual (but non-existent) quality. The rooms, while not looking like much from the photos you may see on websites, are all the worse when you see them in real life. The bed was barely adequate with worn linen and parts of it seeming to have permanent stains. To add insult to injury, I left a scarf in the room by accident. When I contacted the hostel to ask if they had found it, they said yes and very helpfully offered to send it for free if I gave an address which was in Berlin. Coincidentally I had a friend who has a house in Berlin so gladly gave them an address. Turns out that they sent the package by DHL courier and charged the expense to the receiver, so my friend had to pay €15 to receive a small package which travelled maybe 2 miles !!! When I contacted the hostel about this, I of course received no reply. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Needs many improvements!”
Reviews.Author: suhruthu
Reviews.Content: Positive things: Excellent staff, good location, You can easily walk to sights like Check point Charlie.. U-bahn station is also just a short walk.. There is also a direct bus (M41) from Hauptbahnhof that could drop you near this hotel Negative aspects: In terms of comfort of stay, I would say that this hotel performs terribly bad.. We stayed in a 4 bed room in the 5th floor. Through out the night we were disturbed with the sound of U-bahn passing nearby.. So the hotel needs to do something seriously about sound proofing.. Moreover, the curtains were really high and it was really hard even for a person of my height (I'm 5' 11) to move it to cover the windows which in effect made light enter the room throughout the night.. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you are looking for a damn cheap option of stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best for students on a budget who want a good location”
Reviews.Author: vee91
Reviews.Content: The aletto Kreuzberg in Berlin offers a "what you see is what you get" feel. This hotel has more of a hostel feel to it, packed with student tour groups from around the world, clearly taking advantage of the value. The aletto's rooms are small and plain but one can't complain too much considering what you pay. The front desk was helpful with directions and recommendations. It is a 5 min walk from one of 2 nearby subway stations which is convenient and about a 10 minute walk from restaurants and shopping. The biggest complaint would have to be certain excessively noisy tour groups, resulting in sub-par sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP AND COMFORTABLE ACCOMMODATION”
Reviews.Author: toffeeman79
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect with this place as had never stayed in hostel type accommodation before but it definitely exceeded expectations. There were 13 of us staying here for 2 nights as part of a stag weekend. When we arrived we checked in with minimum fuss. We had originally booked 4 rooms - 3 rooms of 4 single beds and a single but at reception we were offered a even cheaper option of 3 triples and a room for 4 that had become available. Needless to say we were impressed with the service and the 70 euros we saved were then spent on the first couple of rounds of drinks! The rooms are what you would expect - basic, however are well maintained have separate toilets and showers in each room and the beds were more comfortable than expected. Breakfast was included as well and was a good quality continental breakfast with plenty to eat. Just dont expect a full cooked breakfast if you want that option go and book into somewhere else. There is complimentary tea/coffee in reception and free internet as well. It is also in a good location which is quiet but nice and central with most of the sights within walking distance. Taxis are also very reasonable for when travelling further. Would definitely stay here again for a similar type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do business with them”
Reviews.Author: an_scii
Reviews.Content: I was going to Berlin and wanted to stay at aletto Kreuzberg Youth Hotel, but i needed to get visa before (yep, i'm from Russia). So i asked these guys and they said - no problem, we can provide booking confirmation by fax. For full non-refundable prepayment. I said - ok, let's do it. They had all necessary info - and they did nothing. They ignored all my emails. Maybe i should call them by phone, but It's XXI century, c'mon! We have e-mail, why should i call and pay not so small money for that? And i didn't have a lot of time to wait for them to wake up and shine. So i booked another hotel. And you know the funniest part of that story? They've answered to my booking cancellation email in half an hour % After days of total ignore.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible deal !!”
Reviews.Author: lancecampeau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, 21 & 22Feb 2010..2 adults & a 4yr old..En suite room with breakfast included was only EUR95!! Excellent location, clean rooms, friendly & helpful staff..2 mins from the nearest subway (Moeckenbruke, not sure of spelling ) , plenty of local resturants close-by..Museum of technology about a 5 min walk..Wish they would have had room for our full stay !! If you are expecting the Ritz you will be let down, if you are expecting a hostel then get ready for a great surprise..!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious well planned accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MrsfussyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay if you are in a group or just want good, clean accommodation of a standard above what you would expect at this price. Nice touches include a great selection of free tea and coffee available 24hours a day in the foyer. The breakfast was excellent. The place is very well run and the staff were charming and efficient. I would certainly stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people are working in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AL0NA
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Berlin for inline skating marathon we arived to this hotel and the staff were very plesent the rooms was clean and it was very good breacfast for me!! not continental!!

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtovarp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, room are ok, bathrooms are pretty good, breakfast also pretty good. the only bad thing about this hotel is the fact that they share the building with a school, you will see teenagers talking loud all the time, long lines for breakfast and get a table. they have a business center which is good, few machines with alcohol, soda, food and games. the hotel is located close to downtown berlin. few restaurants, bar and casino next to it. the customer service is good. we stay far away from teenagers and that part and it was peaceful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not so cheap at the end”
Reviews.Author: Blaise79
Reviews.Content: As in other comments I've already read, the most unpleasent thing is that the hostal is full of children and adolescents making a lot of noise. The rooms are clean, essential and the staff is really kind. I've paid 39€ for a night in a single room, that is a good price, maybe just a little expensive. The position is the city is confortable, close to a U-bahn station, quite close to a S-bahn station (Anhalter Station) and close as well to go to Potsdamer Platz on foot (about 10 minutes walking)

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a mix...”
Reviews.Author: amew1982
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of a week long trip (involving another hotel in Berlin, Dresden and Prague). I hate to say this but I wouldn't return to this hostel. The staff were WONDERFUL, without a doubt, and the best thing about the hostel. Very friendly and charming. I pretty disappointed with our twin room though. We had a corner room with private WC and Shower room, that was clean and simple. Our sleeping quarters felt a bit industrial, harsh strip lighting, with pathetic little bedhead lamps. there was a great fat pillar in the middle of the small room, a precariously positioned tv shelf (the cause of a good few knocks and bumps on our heads), and lots of squashed mosquitos over the celing. There was quite a bit of noise generated by teenage school kids; that combined with the attempt to cover over the glass panelled doors meant that I got a bad night's sleep. These things sound trivial perhaps, but we had stayed in other hostel accommodation during our trip and the standard of living space were much better. I'm glad we only had one night here....

HotelInfo.Name: aletto Kreuzberg Youth Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Tempelhofer Ufer 8/9, 10963 Berlin, Germany
